  "description": "TopHire Africa&nbsp;is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that&#39;s geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitatively verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager / Head of Admin with FMCG experience
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To ensure the smooth running of the company&rsquo;s administrative activities through office and facility management, staff development, and technical support.
	We need a person who will be responsible for overseeing all HR and administrative processes, such as payroll supervision, benefits administration, recruitment procedures, employee relations, and onboarding processes.
	You will also be expected to monitor proper organizational and HR policy implementation to ensure the company&rsquo;s compliance with local employment law


Responsibilities


	Provide reports on all areas of HR, Payroll and Learning and Development, including the application of Employment Law, HR policy, best practice and workforce development.
	Advise and strategise on the development of effective employment policies across the company.
	Provide professional leadership, support and development to HR staff, in order to increase knowledge, share best practice and to ensure that relevant professional standards are met.
	Ensure that the company complies with current regulations, accepted professional standards, policies and procedures and legislation (including legislation on data protection, the Equality Act and health and safety).
	Manage the execution of the HR Strategy and core areas of the HR department including Recruitment, Employee Relations, Workforce Administration, Employee Engagement, Payroll, Reward and Recognition, as well as maintaining and improving HR systems and management of the HR budget.
	Drive the continuous improvement agenda with focus on engagement &amp; welfare activities, maximising productivity, devolving HR responsibilities to line managers and building leadership capability.
	Take a lead role in transforming and strengthening the organisational culture, ensuring that the company values and approach are displayed.
	Execute a plan for diversity, equality, and inclusion that aligns with company values, business strategy and commitments.
	Regularly coach, mentor and support senior and high potential colleagues to identify individual strengths and development needs, develop and maintain effective relationships and encourage retention.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree with 7 - 8 years of work experience.


Salary
N700,000 - N800,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to:&nbsp;tophireafrica@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Positionn as the subject of the mail.",

Human Resource Manager / Head of Admin with FMCG experience Job at TopHire Africa




        
    

        
        TopHire Africa is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that's geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitatively verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager / Head of Admin with FMCG experience
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	To ensure the smooth running of the company’s administrative activities through office and facility management, staff development, and technical support.
	We need a person who will be responsible for overseeing all HR and administrative processes, such as payroll supervision, benefits administration, recruitment procedures, employee relations, and onboarding processes.
	You will also be expected to monitor proper organizational and HR policy implementation to ensure the company’s compliance with local employment law


Responsibilities


	Provide reports on all areas of HR, Payroll and Learning and Development, including the application of Employment Law, HR policy, best practice and workforce development.
	Advise and strategise on the development of effective employment policies across the company.
	Provide professional leadership, support and development to HR staff, in order to increase knowledge, share best practice and to ensure that relevant professional standards are met.
	Ensure that the company complies with current regulations, accepted professional standards, policies and procedures and legislation (including legislation on data protection, the Equality Act and health and safety).
	Manage the execution of the HR Strategy and core areas of the HR department including Recruitment, Employee Relations, Workforce Administration, Employee Engagement, Payroll, Reward and Recognition, as well as maintaining and improving HR systems and management of the HR budget.
	Drive the continuous improvement agenda with focus on engagement & welfare activities, maximising productivity, devolving HR responsibilities to line managers and building leadership capability.
	Take a lead role in transforming and strengthening the organisational culture, ensuring that the company values and approach are displayed.
	Execute a plan for diversity, equality, and inclusion that aligns with company values, business strategy and commitments.
	Regularly coach, mentor and support senior and high potential colleagues to identify individual strengths and development needs, develop and maintain effective relationships and encourage retention.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree with 7 - 8 years of work experience.


Salary
N700,000 - N800,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: tophireafrica@gmail.com using the Job Positionn as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Group Company Secretary",
  "description": "Tophire Africa&nbsp;is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that&#39;s geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitative verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Group Company Secretary&nbsp;
Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT), Lagos and Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Support the Group Company Secretary in ensuring effective corporate governance practices and compliance with statutory and regulatory obligations across the Group and its subsidiaries.
	Coordinate and document Board, Board Committee, and General Meetings, including preparing meeting notices, collating and distributing board packs, attending meetings, recording high-quality minutes, and tracking follow-up actions.
	Maintain and routinely update statutory registers and the corporate compliance calendar, ensuring timely filings and alerts for key governance activities.
	Prepare and file statutory returns and disclosures with regulatory bodies such as the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC), Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and Nigerian Exchange Group (NGX) in line with regulatory timelines.
	Assist in the end-to-end planning and execution of the Annual General Meeting (AGM), including preparation of the notice of meeting, shareholder communications, and engagement with registrars and service providers.
	Provide governance and administrative support in relation to Board and Committee evaluations, policy reviews, and implementation of Board decisions.
	Support the onboarding, induction, and continuous education of directors, including the preparation of induction materials and training schedules.
	Conduct preliminary legal and regulatory research to support secretariat operations and advisory governance.
	Liaise with external counsel, registrars, and other service providers on corporate governance and regulatory compliance matters.
	Support the management of governance documentation including Board resolutions, policy archives, charters, and corporate filings.


Qualifications


	A university degree at minimum second class or its equivalent Law or law-related course. A master&rsquo;s degree is preferred&nbsp;with 10-12years of experience.
	Admitted to the Nigerian Bar Association
	12 years of relatable experience, of which 5 must include Board engagement and a strong focus on working with publicly quoted companies.
	Proven experience in at least one of our investment sectors: power, hospitality, oil and gas, or energy is an added advantage.
	In-depth knowledge of corporate governance principles, regulations, and compliance requirements for publicly quoted companies.
	Experience with relevant legal frameworks and industry practices within any of our investment sectors.

Group Company Secretary Job at Tophire Africa




        
    

        
        Tophire Africa is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that's geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitative verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Group Company Secretary 
Job Locations: Abuja (FCT), Lagos and Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Support the Group Company Secretary in ensuring effective corporate governance practices and compliance with statutory and regulatory obligations across the Group and its subsidiaries.
	Coordinate and document Board, Board Committee, and General Meetings, including preparing meeting notices, collating and distributing board packs, attending meetings, recording high-quality minutes, and tracking follow-up actions.
	Maintain and routinely update statutory registers and the corporate compliance calendar, ensuring timely filings and alerts for key governance activities.
	Prepare and file statutory returns and disclosures with regulatory bodies such as the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC), Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and Nigerian Exchange Group (NGX) in line with regulatory timelines.
	Assist in the end-to-end planning and execution of the Annual General Meeting (AGM), including preparation of the notice of meeting, shareholder communications, and engagement with registrars and service providers.
	Provide governance and administrative support in relation to Board and Committee evaluations, policy reviews, and implementation of Board decisions.
	Support the onboarding, induction, and continuous education of directors, including the preparation of induction materials and training schedules.
	Conduct preliminary legal and regulatory research to support secretariat operations and advisory governance.
	Liaise with external counsel, registrars, and other service providers on corporate governance and regulatory compliance matters.
	Support the management of governance documentation including Board resolutions, policy archives, charters, and corporate filings.


Qualifications


	A university degree at minimum second class or its equivalent Law or law-related course. A master’s degree is preferred with 10-12years of experience.
	Admitted to the Nigerian Bar Association
	12 years of relatable experience, of which 5 must include Board engagement and a strong focus on working with publicly quoted companies.
	Proven experience in at least one of our investment sectors: power, hospitality, oil and gas, or energy is an added advantage.
	In-depth knowledge of corporate governance principles, regulations, and compliance requirements for publicly quoted companies.
	Experience with relevant legal frameworks and industry practices within any of our investment sectors.
	An in-house Company Secretarial/Legal team of a public listed company, at a mid-senior level.
	Assist in the coordination and oversight of secretarial functions for subsidiaries within the Transcorp Group to ensure standardization and alignment with group governance requirements
